fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Competition, Consumers, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Regional Policy, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Communication, European Neighbourhood Policy
eu_initiatives: Energy Union, 2030 Energy & Climate Framework, EED, EPBD, RED and Concerted Actions; Covenant of Mayors, Governance & Cohesion Policy, H2020,
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: Beispiele: EnR, World Energy Council, aireg, Baltic Sea Forum, Deutsch-Französischer Wirtschaftskreis, Deutsch-Russisches Forum e.V., Osteuropaverein, enercity, EWI, VDA, erdgas mobil
relevant_communication:
EU Projects (H2020): EU HEROES, THERMOS 
EU Projects (IEE): WISE Power, e-Highways 2050, Qualitrain, Cohereno, BiomassPolicies, GreenGasGrids 
INTERREG (Baltic Sea Region): Scandria   
Other activities: Initiative Energieeffizienz (incl. Toprunner, EU Label etc.); German representation in the European Energy Network (EnR, incl. EnR presidency 2016, chairing one working group - Renewable Energy Working Group; Deutsch-Französische Energieplattform / Smart Border Initiative (German-Franco Energy Platform in partnership with ADEME), Allianz für Gebäude-Energie-Effizienz - geea (Europe) 
Study for the European Commission: Study on the Implementation of Article 7(3) of the "Directive on the Deployment of Alternative Fuels Infrastructure"- Fuel Price Comparison
goals__remit: dena is Germany’s centre of expertise for energy efficiency, renewable energy sources and intelligent energy systems. As 'Agency for Applied Energy Transition', it contributes to attaining the goals of energy and climate politics by developing solutions and putting them into practice, both nationally and internationally. In order to do this, it brings together partners from all areas of politics, business, academia and civil society. dena’s shareholders are the Federal Republic of Germany and the KfW Group.
